title: Getting Started as a Teaching Assistant

sections.heading: Welcome to AI Engagement Hub
sections.content: As a Teaching Assistant, you have enhanced privileges to support instructors in course management, grading assistance, and student mentorship. This role combines educational support with administrative responsibilities.

sections.heading: Understanding Your Role
sections.content: Teaching Assistants serve as key support staff for instructors while maintaining direct engagement with students.

subsections.heading: Primary Responsibilities
subsections.content: Assist with grading and assessment. Monitor student progress and engagement. Provide advanced academic support. Help manage course administration.

subsections.heading: Your Permissions
subsections.content: View individual student chat histories. Access detailed analytics and reports. Manage student groups and projects. Add comments and feedback to student work.

subsections.heading: Role Limitations
subsections.content: Cannot modify course structure or settings. Cannot change final grades without approval. Cannot access other courses without permission. Must coordinate major decisions with instructor.

sections.heading: Initial Setup
sections.content: Getting your Teaching Assistant account configured properly.

subsections.heading: Account Activation
subsections.content: Instructor promotes you to Teaching Assistant role. Receive notification of enhanced permissions. Review new dashboard features available. Complete any required training modules.

subsections.heading: Course Access
subsections.content: Verify access to assigned courses. Review course syllabus and AI policies. Understand grading rubrics and standards. Familiarize yourself with student roster.

subsections.heading: Tool Configuration
subsections.content: Set up notification preferences. Configure analytics dashboard views. Organize workflow for efficiency. Create templates for common feedback.

sections.heading: Student Interaction Management
sections.content: Monitoring and supporting student AI usage effectively.

subsections.heading: Reviewing Chat Histories
subsections.content: Access individual student conversations. Evaluate prompt quality and responses. Identify learning patterns and challenges. Flag exceptional or concerning interactions.

subsections.heading: Providing Feedback
subsections.content: Add constructive comments to chats. Suggest prompt improvements. Highlight exemplary usage. Create feedback reports for instructors.

subsections.heading: Progress Tracking
subsections.content: Monitor individual student metrics. Track assignment completion rates. Identify at-risk students early. Generate progress reports.

subsections.heading: Academic Support
subsections.content: Schedule one-on-one help sessions. Provide targeted AI usage guidance. Help students improve prompt engineering. Support project development.

sections.heading: Grading and Assessment
sections.content: Supporting the evaluation of AI-assisted student work.

subsections.heading: Evaluation Criteria
subsections.content: Assess quality of AI interactions. Evaluate prompt sophistication. Measure learning progression. Check for academic integrity.

subsections.heading: Grading Support
subsections.content: Pre-grade assignments for instructor review. Apply rubrics consistently. Document grading decisions. Maintain grading records.

subsections.heading: Feedback Delivery
subsections.content: Write detailed assignment feedback. Explain grading decisions clearly. Suggest improvement strategies. Encourage continued learning.

subsections.heading: Academic Integrity
subsections.content: Monitor for inappropriate AI usage. Verify original student thinking. Report suspected violations. Document evidence properly.

sections.heading: Analytics and Reporting
sections.content: Using data to support course improvement.

subsections.heading: Dashboard Analytics
subsections.content: Access comprehensive usage statistics. Track model preference trends. Monitor cost distributions. Analyze engagement patterns.

subsections.heading: Student Analytics
subsections.content: Review individual performance metrics. Compare student progress. Identify usage patterns. Track improvement over time.

subsections.heading: Report Generation
subsections.content: Create weekly progress summaries. Generate assessment reports. Compile usage statistics. Prepare data for instructor meetings.

subsections.heading: Data Interpretation
subsections.content: Identify trends and patterns. Recognize outliers and anomalies. Make data-driven recommendations. Support evidence-based decisions.

subsections.heading: Enrollment Support
subsections.content: Help process enrollment requests. Verify student prerequisites. Manage waitlist communications. Update student rosters.

subsections.heading: Group Management
subsections.content: Create and organize student groups. Monitor group collaborations. Resolve group conflicts. Track group project progress.

subsections.heading: Resource Management
subsections.content: Upload course materials. Organize assignment resources. Maintain help documentation. Update course announcements.

subsections.heading: Communication Coordination
subsections.content: Draft course announcements. Respond to routine inquiries. Schedule office hours. Coordinate with other TAs.

sections.heading: Advanced AI Support
sections.content: Providing sophisticated AI assistance to students.

subsections.heading: Model Optimization
subsections.content: Recommend optimal model selection. Demonstrate advanced features. Explain model capabilities. Guide cost-effective usage.

subsections.heading: Prompt Engineering
subsections.content: Teach advanced prompting techniques. Create prompt templates. Review and improve student prompts. Share best practices.

subsections.heading: Troubleshooting
subsections.content: Diagnose complex AI issues. Provide technical solutions. Document problem resolutions. Escalate platform bugs.

subsections.heading: Innovation Support
subsections.content: Encourage creative AI applications. Support experimental usage. Share innovative examples. Foster AI literacy development.

subsections.heading: Regular Communication
subsections.content: Schedule weekly check-ins. Provide status updates. Share student insights. Request guidance on issues.

subsections.heading: Decision Support
subsections.content: Present data-driven recommendations. Suggest course improvements. Report student concerns. Propose policy adjustments.

subsections.heading: Task Coordination
subsections.content: Clarify responsibilities. Meet deadlines consistently. Manage workload effectively. Communicate availability clearly.

subsections.heading: Professional Development
subsections.content: Seek feedback on performance. Request additional training. Share learning experiences. Build teaching skills.

sections.heading: Best Practices
sections.content: Guidelines for excellence as a Teaching Assistant.

subsections.heading: Time Management
subsections.content: Prioritize urgent tasks. Create efficient workflows. Set realistic deadlines. Maintain work-life balance.

subsections.heading: Communication Excellence
subsections.content: Respond promptly to messages. Write clear, professional emails. Provide detailed explanations. Maintain consistent tone.

subsections.heading: Educational Support
subsections.content: Adapt to different learning styles. Provide personalized guidance. Encourage student autonomy. Celebrate student achievements.

subsections.heading: Professional Ethics
subsections.content: Maintain confidentiality. Avoid conflicts of interest. Treat all students fairly. Uphold academic standards.

subsections.heading: Grading Disputes
subsections.content: Listen to student concerns. Review grading criteria. Consult with instructor. Document resolution process.

subsections.heading: Student Complaints
subsections.content: Remain professional and objective. Gather all relevant information. Escalate when appropriate. Follow up on resolutions.

subsections.heading: Workload Management
subsections.content: Communicate capacity limits. Request help when needed. Delegate when possible. Maintain quality standards.

subsections.heading: Technical Issues
subsections.content: Document problems thoroughly. Provide temporary workarounds. Coordinate with IT support. Keep stakeholders informed.

subsections.heading: Training Resources
subsections.content: Access TA training modules. Review grading guidelines. Study platform documentation. Attend professional workshops.

subsections.heading: Support Channels
subsections.content: Connect with other TAs. Join TA discussion forums. Access instructor resources. Contact platform support.

subsections.heading: Professional Growth
subsections.content: Seek mentorship opportunities. Build teaching portfolio. Document achievements. Request recommendation letters.
